Dispute_Type: Administrative dispute over environmental protection obligations
Legal_Issue: Whether the Minister erred in failing to identify critical habitat for the Greater Sage-Grouse as required by SARA
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence showed that active leks and some nesting/brood-rearing habitats were identifiable using existing models and data
Decision_Outcome: The Minister's decision not to identify any critical habitat was unreasonable
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant organizations to demonstrate unreasonableness
Credibility_Factor: Scientific data and models supporting habitat identification were credible and available
Legal_Rule: Under SARA, Section 41(1)(c), the Minister must identify critical habitat 'to the extent possible' based on the best available information
Procedural_Issue: Failure to comply with statutory requirements in developing the recovery strategy
Grounds_for_Claim: Omission of critical habitat identification in the recovery strategy despite available data
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Minister failed to follow mandatory procedural steps under SARA
Key_Evidence_Considered: Existing ecological models and data on sage-grouse habitats
Legal_Framework: Statutory interpretation of SARA, particularly Section 41(1)(c)
Applicant_Challenge: Non-profit organizations challenged the legality of the recovery strategy
Court_Result: Judicial review granted; section on critical habitat must be redrafted within a specified timeframe
Defendant_Response: Minister argued that identifying critical habitat was not feasible due to insufficient data
Remedy_Requested: Redrafting of the critical habitat section in the recovery strategy
Outcome: Remedy granted; Minister required to redraft
Remedy_Sought: Order compelling compliance with SARA's habitat identification requirement
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under administrative law principles
Authority: Minister of Environment or equivalent federal authority
Applicable_Process: Judicial review process under Canadian administrative law
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Mandatory order to redraft recovery strategy component
Governing_Rule: Statutory duty under SARA to identify critical habitat to the extent possible
